author: 市场资讯
title: 刘畅北大讲话：跳出规模崇拜，不要亏、不能亏_新浪财经_新浪网
text:
炒股就看 金麒麟分析师研报 ，权威，专业，及时，全面，助您挖掘潜力主题机会！
　　来源：新肉业
　　日前，北大国发院召开2024年度总结暨表彰大会，授予 新希望 六和董事长刘畅等五位校友“北大国发院三十周年杰出校友”称号。
　　会上，刘畅以鲜活经历揭示：在AI冲击与管理范式迭代的当下，中国企业如何以“因信而立、因爱而久”的信念，跳出规模崇拜，用根植中国文化的管理哲学重塑竞争力。
　　以下为刘畅讲话全文。
　　 摸索一条真正适用于
　　 中国企业的管理之道
　　 刘 畅
　　（新希望六和董事长）
　　我记得上一次在北大国发院是将近四年前的分享，主题是我们集团发展到40周年，我们如何裂变，如何从一个行业的大王变成一个生态链的链主，以什么样的姿态去面对产业以及产业上下游的升级转型。
　　 所以当时我父亲提出“大王向后退，强将往前冲”，也正是他自己确实以这样的一个姿态做到了， 他现在连我们最大的实体的上市公司（指新希望六和）的董事都退出了 ，今年刚刚才退出的。
　　当时我说爸爸你在董事会里面，你护着我说话护了这么多年了。他说因为他现在的角色已经越来越被社会化、被代表化。他说我说多说少，可能对上市公司会有影响。他说你们已经成熟了，你们都往前一点。
　　 但就在2021年，外部环境急转直下，过去这几年，我想在座的很多同学可能也都经历了我们的经历。
　　 在这几年当中，我自己开始长白头发， 我一直以为我是基因更像爸爸，大家看我爸爸好像现在也没有几根白头发，特别佩服他的心态， 无论经历什么样的事情，他没有睡不好过，没有吃不好过，永远是那样的心平气和的状态，他是我们整个集团的一个定海神针。
　　但这种笃定的心态源于父辈经历过更艰难的岁月，“再差不会比我们年轻时差了”。
　　 我没有想到，在过去这几年，短短的几个月当中，我长了好多白头发。 我到现在为止睡眠都不好，可能是被一段时间强大的压力害得。
　　我是出生在80年代的，跟新希望这个企业是情如兄妹地一起长大，但没有经过特别苦的日子，这个阶段就像最近流行的一个词叫“经济上行的美”——开心地一路向上。哪经历过这几年的事？
　　真睡不着。客观数字上的亏损，变成了我的心病，最后我说一定要用行动来改变。于是我想管他的，“舍我其谁”，在这过去的这两三年当中，我们带领团队和有经验的一线干部，以二次创业的心态，直面当下的困难。
　　我这两三年走访了非常多的企业家，“养猪行业会不会变成钢铁行业、水泥行业？最后会剩下谁？”
　　我又拜访了很多科创型企业，发现他们的成功来得很快、很猛。
　　因为我们是不一样的生态——就像森林里的大树一样，各种动物所需要的营养都不同。
　　我就想到，何必去跟互联网企业比增长时速、比绝对盈利水平？一个互联网企业可能一年上千亿的利润，不到十年就形成一个收入规模。
　　 但是我们有什么问题？
　　我在一线调研时发现，其实各行各业发生的变化都是同样的——过去的销售本质上是做渠道，舒舒服服地过了二三十年，可今天经销商的竞争是最惨烈的，我们看到各行各业的经销商四个变三个，三个变两个。
　　 以前我们作为厂家只需要把产品卖出去就可以了，今天我们要帮着把下游服务给做好。 所以，今天我们面对的其实是经销商的升级和业绩的转型。
　　在走访过程中，我还发现，在大企业之外，还有更多的小企业，接班的8090后们，也在运用新思维、新技术、新模式，他们也是我的希望。
　　比如我去拜访过一位湖北的年轻养殖户，他继承家业后，通过在网上学习新技术、线下捣腾新设备，把自己的试验场打理得很好，同时也将成功经验推给其他养户，最后自己变成了散户群里的自养和经销相结合的商家。
　　 我又发现，小企业的铁律就是不要亏、不能亏。 于是我们用小企业的精神做大企业，要祛除大公司病，比如倡导开短会、不做PPT等，让真正有资源整合能力的干部到一线去，现场解决问题，限期解决问题。
　　 我们就是这样，用二次创业的精神， 一切以经营为核心的精神 ，破我们自己的大公司病。
　　 这个过程中，我一直在提的一句话叫做因信而立，因爱而久， 这句话我特别想拿来分享，因为在多次的一线调研和外部沟通当中，我最终发现了，最后大家相信的是这个行业。
　　 我不必羡慕那些互联网的企业能够十年间创下万亿的帝国。我不再去羡慕别人有多么美丽的翅膀了， 我骄傲于我在这个生生不息、永远存在的农牧行业、这个不断探索蛋白质、营养、生物科技前沿的行业。
　　 人家讲百战归来再求学，我也是这两年经历了起落后，来校友会做分享。当年我们在国发院时，学的是比较偏西方的一些管理知识，但事实上在过去的传统中国企业中，比如山西平遥的银庄商号， 他们培养传承人、专业技能、品格素质、行业认知的那一套方法，也是适用于中国现代企业的。
　　希望我们北大国发院能够继续师生同心，一起去摸索一条真正适用于我们中国的企业之道，用植根于中国文化的管理哲学去培养、帮助我们的企业家。
新浪声明：此消息系转载自新浪合作媒体，新浪网登载此文出于传递更多信息之目的，并不意味着赞同其观点或证实其描述。文章内容仅供参考，不构成投资建议。投资者据此操作，风险自担。
topics: Economy, Business and Finance->business strategy and marketing

author: Diario Libre
title: Miles huyen tras bombardeos israelíes en Líbano - Diario Libre
text:
En cuatro días de bombardeos israelís, miles de personas, entre ellos, libaneses y sirios han huido de Líbano a su vecina Siria , tras versen forzados a abandonar sus hogares.
Desde el lunes más de 22,000 personas que huían de los bombardeos israelíes en Líbano entraron en Siria , indicaron este jueves fuentes de la seguridad sirias.
Según dicha fuente, que pidió el anonimato, "el número total de personas que entraron a través del paso fronterizo de Jdeidet Yabus en los tres últimos días y hasta el jueves por la mañana es de más de 6,000 libaneses y unos 15,000 sirios", además indicaron que 1,000 libaneses y 500 sirios habían pasado por Jusiyah otro punto fronterizo.
El masivo desplazamiento empezó a producirse luego de que este fin de semana Israel empezara a bombardear Líbano abiertamente.
El ministerio libanés de Salud indicó este jueves que 20 personas, casi todas sirias, murieron en un ataque israelí efectuado de madrugada en el este de Líbano . "Un bombardeo del enemigo israelí en el pueblo de Yunin" mató a "20 personas, entre ellas 19 sirios", indicó el ministerio en un comunicado, elevando un balance anterior de nueve muertos.
Por su parte, Israel, sigue sin dar señales de tregua y afirmó este jueves que seguirá combatiendo a Hezbolá en Líbano "hasta la victoria", y rechazó así un llamamiento conjunto de un alto el fuego de 21 días por parte de Estados Unidos, Francia y otros aliados.
Por cuarto día consecutivo, el ejército israelí lanzó una andanada de bombardeos contra bastiones del movimiento islamista en Líbano , mientras que el grupo apoyado por Irán volvió a disparar proyectiles contra complejos militares israelíes.
En total más de 90,000 personas se vieron forzadas desde el lunes a abandonar sus hogares en Líbano a causa de los ataques del Estado Hebreo, según un recuento de la ONU de este miércoles.
TEMAS - Bombardeos israelíes Seguir Tema + Siguiendo ✓ Desplazados Seguir Tema + Siguiendo ✓ LÍBANO Seguir Tema + Siguiendo ✓ Siria Seguir Tema + Siguiendo ✓ Hezbolá Seguir Tema + Siguiendo ✓ Refugiados Seguir Tema + Siguiendo ✓ RFI RFI es una radio francesa de actualidad, difundida a escala mundial en francés y en 15 idiomas más, mediante 156 repetidores de FM en ondas medias y cortas en una treintena de satélites a destino de los cinco continentes, en Internet y en aplicaciones conectadas, que cuenta con más de 2,000 radios asociadas que emiten sus programas.
En portada Ver todos Economía Conep propone revisión costo-efecto de las exenciones y no eliminación generalizada

author: Arnaud Hermant
title: Le CUP, omniprésent et garant de l'ambiance au Parc des Princes
text:
La performance XXL réalisée par le PSG mercredi contre Manchester City (4-2) est l'oeuvre de Luis Enrique, de son staff et des joueurs. Mais d'autres acteurs ont joué un rôle : les spectateurs présents, et principalement le Collectif Ultras Paris (CUP), omniprésent toute la soirée, qui a chanté et fait chanter tout le Parc pendant plus d'une heure et demie.
L'ÉQUIPE Quand il a fallu accueillir les joueurs 90 minutes avant le coup d'envoi devant le tapis rouge de l'entrée principale, le club a fait appel à ses ultras, à grand renfort de fumigènes. C'est à lui que l'on doit aussi l'immense tifo sur trois tribunes avec le slogan de la ville de Paris « Fluctuat Nec Mergitur ». Il a été concocté avec le soutien financier du club. Quand il s'est agi d'ambiancer la tribune Boulogne, c'est encore lui qui a été appelé à la rescousse. Quelque 400 habitués d'Auteuil, dont beaucoup de membres du CUP, ont ainsi migré dans l'autre virage. Et pour eux, le club a changé les règles en vigueur. Fini les places attribuées à l'année, c'était placement libre et possibilité de se mettre debout pour encourager l'équipe « alors que d'habitude on est menacé par les stadiers d'être sorti si on se lève. En fait, le PSG fait comme ça l'arrange » , regrette Olivier, un abonné de Boulogne pas mécontent que cette partie du stade chante aussi.
De plus en plus de pouvoir Mercredi, impossible aussi pour des supporters non autorisés de se placer où ils voulaient malgré le placement libre décrété, des stadiers filtraient l'accès à des espaces réservés aux ultras. D'autres groupes ont bien tenté ces dernières années de mettre de l'ambiance à Boulogne, comme le Block Parisii, mais le club l'a écarté, craignant le retour dans son giron de certains anciens du kop of Boulogne.
Pour plusieurs observateurs, et notamment les services de police présents au Parc, le PSG se montre conciliant avec ses supporters dynamiques. Trop, pour certains, à l'image de l'affaire du tifo « Free Palestine » déployé contre l'Atlético de Madrid (1-2) début novembre qui a suscité des remous. Preuve de son pouvoir, le CUP avait obtenu il y a quelques années le remplacement de la société de sécurité qui gérait Auteuil. Cette omnipotence fait des jaloux. C'est peut-être le prix à payer pour une telle l'ambiance.
lire aussi « Ça se fera en équipe » : les coulisses de la victoire du PSG contre Manchester City en Ligue des champions 22 commentaires 10 réactions ajouter un commentaire réagir à l'article Les commentaires sont soumis à des règles de modération. lire la charte T Talasani C’était incandescent hier. Quelle communion entre un public et son équipe !!!! Dans ce domaine là aussi Paris est inégalable. Aucun club en Europe ne connaît pareille ambiance et pareils supporters. Ce public qui pousse est à associer aux performances stratosphériques comme la victoire d’hier. Bravo au CUP 17 réagir signaler 16min afficher 21 autres commentaires L'ÉQUIPE chrono filtrer : football L'ÉQUIPE le journal lire l'édition L'ÉQUIPE L'ÉQUIPE

author: McKenna Horsley
title: Opportunity to ‘redefine ourselves’: Board OKs recommendations for community college system
text:
Opportunity to ‘redefine ourselves’: Board OKs recommendations for community college system McKenna Horsley Thu, December 5, 2024 at 10:21 PM UTC 3 min read
The Kentucky Community and Technical College System is made up of 16 colleges across Kentucky. Its headquarters, above, is in Versailles. (KCTCS photo)
VERSAILLES — The Kentucky Community and Technical College System Board of Regents approved 11 recommendations for changes to the system in response to a directive earlier this year from the state legislature.
Ryan Quarles (KCTCS photo) The recommendations include changes to KCTCS’ governance, making the system the sole provider of dual credit courses in Kentucky and evaluating areas for possible mergers and consolidations.
Advertisement Advertisement Advertisement Senate Joint Resolution 179 , passed by the General Assembly earlier this year, directed KCTCS to review and report findings on ways to improve the functionally of the two-year college system. The legislature set a Dec. 10 deadline for the report. The 11 recommendations will be presented to lawmakers on the Interim Joint Committee on Education next week.
KCTCS President Ryan Quarles described the meeting to discuss the recommendations as an opportunity for the college system to “redefine ourselves.”
The 11 recommendations are:
Strengthen academic training and program offerings.
Establish a comprehensive KCTCS workforce plan that may include financial and academic supports, career counseling and experiential learning elements.
Evaluate KCTCS’ geographical footprint, including the need for merger and consolidations.
Preserve college-level accreditation and focus on shared services and integration across KCTCS.
Reform KCTCS governance, including the makeup of the Board of Regents.
Recommend a 100% outcomes-based funding model for KCTCS if the legislature will set KCTCS’ state appropriations at or above the average rate of comparable states.
Expand credential eligibility and funding for the Work Ready Scholarship.
Make no changes to the KCTCS personnel system.
KCTCS should be the sole provider of dual credit in Kentucky. Dual credit allows high school students to take college-level courses and earn college credit.
Address transferability of associate degrees to four-year institutions.
Repeal outdated language and statutes in state law.
Quarles became president of KCTCS in January amid concerns raised by several reviews, audits and studies. KCTCS released findings from a forensic audit in November, which found no fraud or criminal behavior but a need to improve internal policies and procedures.
Advertisement Advertisement Findings from a Huron Consulting Group study and audits were part of the foundation for the General Assembly’s resolution calling on KCTCS to examine itself. That legislation was carried by Senate President Robert Stivers, R-Manchester.
While presenting the recommendations to the board, Quarles, a former Kentucky agriculture commissioner and Republican state representative, recalled his own legislative experience. He emphasized that the 11 points were merely recommendations.
“It is rare to have a piece of legislation where you agree with 100% of what’s in it,” Quarles said. “So, I’m asking you to do something that can transform this organization.”
Before the board voted on the recommendations, board Secretary Brianna Sanders Whitten made a motion to vote separately on the recommended changes to KCTCS’ governance, but the motion failed. The full recommendation includes changing the terms of appointed board members to four years instead of six with the chance to be reappointed.
Advertisement Advertisement More in U.S. Passenger stinks up entire plane with ‘diabolical’ in-flight meal choice: ‘Scented food is a crime’ NY Post Cops Close in on Grinning Suspect in UnitedHealthcare CEO’s Murder as They Probe Gun Purchase The Daily Beast Massive lottery jackpot is set to expire. Mystery player was part of an incredibly rare draw LA Times 'Today' anchor Hoda Kotb says a former boss told her she might want to 'get on the treadmill' Business Insider Whistleblower suit alleges waste, mismanagement, illegality in KY’s community college system
All board members present Thursday ultimately voted in favor of the 11 recommendations.
KCTCS has more than 100,000 students across 16 colleges in Kentucky.
The system is currently facing a whistleblower lawsuit from a former chief of staff, Hannah Rivera, who alleges she faced retaliation for making “numerous good faith reports of waste, mismanagement, and violations of the laws of the Commonwealth of Kentucky.” In her complaint, Rivera said she wrote the legislation that became SJR 179. A motion hour will be held in the case next week — after the legislature’s education committee meeting.
The board went behind closed doors during Thursday’s meeting for a 45-minute executive session to discuss proposed or pending litigation.

author: marilou.
title: prima scomparsa di una specie di uccello continentale in Europa \u2013 Lib\u00e9ration
text:
Questo uccello è considerato estinto con una probabilità del 96%, riferisce la LPO questo giovedì 21 novembre. Se le cause di questa scomparsa sono incerte, potrebbe aver avuto un ruolo la perdita del suo habitat e la caccia.
Il collasso della biodiversità continua, in un silenzio assordante. Un uccello migratore, il chiurlo dal becco sottile, è probabilmente estinto, annuncia uno studio pubblicato il 17 novembre. Si tratta della prima scomparsa di un uccello continentale nell'area che unisce Europa, Nord Africa e Asia occidentale, ha deplorato giovedì la Bird Protection League (LPO).
Secondo questo articolo pubblicato sulla rivista ornitologica IBIS, il chiurlo dal becco sottile, dal piumaggio leggero e dal becco ricurvo, non è stato visto con certezza dal 1995, quando è stato avvistato in Marocco, nonostante ricerche approfondite. Secondo le norme dell'Unione internazionale per la conservazione della natura (IUCN), è quindi estinto con una probabilità del 96%, scrivono gli autori. Nell'ultima lista rossa IUCN, questo uccello è stato classificato come in pericolo di estinzione.
Fallimento della cooperazione internazionale
Il chiurlo dal becco stretto sarebbe la terza specie della zona paleartica occidentale ad essere dichiarata estinta dall'inizio del monitoraggio naturalista nel 1500, dopo un pinguino visto l'ultima volta nel 1844 e una beccaccia di mare scomparsa intorno al 1940, ma che vivevano a loro volta su isole e non nel continente. Se sono state avanzate diverse ipotesi per spiegare la scomparsa del chiurlo dal becco sottile (perdita dell'habitat, caccia) è difficile trarre una conclusione chiara.
«Le pressioni che hanno portato all’estinzione della specie sono per lo più deduzioni non convalidate e potrebbero non essere mai comprese e quantificate.scrivono gli autori dello studio, che giudicano “essenziale” che si imparino le lezioni. “Tali estinzioni sono un indicatore del fallimento della cooperazione internazionale sulla conservazione della biodiversità”scrivono. Pochi giorni prima, lo scorso ottobre, la COP16 sulla biodiversità tenutasi a Cali, che avrebbe dovuto portare avanti gli obblighi delle nazioni del mondo in termini di protezione della natura, si era conclusa con un clamoroso fallimento, soprattutto sulla questione dei finanziamenti.
I timori riguardanti la preservazione del chiurlo dal becco sottile sono antichi. Già nel 1912 gli scienziati si accorsero che era in declino, subito dopo la scoperta dei primi potenziali nidi, e già negli anni Quaranta si parlò della possibilità della sua estinzione. Tuttavia solo alla fine degli anni Ottanta il l'uccello è classificato come minacciato.
“È fondamentale comprendere l’importanza del segnale d’allarme rappresentato dall’estinzione del chiurlo, perché potrebbe inaugurare una lunga serie di eventi macabri se non agiamo”ha dichiarato Allain Bougrain-Dubourg, presidente della LPO. “Gli animali che un tempo erano comuni come i passeri, le rondini o i ricci vedono ora le loro popolazioni crollare”ha sottolineato in un comunicato stampa, “Abbiamo urgentemente bisogno di svegliarci!”

author: newsdesk@nottinghampost.com (Laycie Beck)
title: 9 flood alerts in place for Nottinghamshire as Storm Gerrit to bring more rain
text: There are several flood alerts in place across [Nottinghamshire ](https://www.nottinghampost.com/all-about/nottinghamshire)following the recent heavy rain from Storm Gerrit. Flooding is possible at the River Idle, River Maun, River Meden, River Trent and River Trent Tributaries. Also at risk is the River Leen, Day Brook, Tottle Brook, the River Erewash and the River Erewash Tributaries. Storm Gerrit is bringing strong winds and heavy rain to parts of the UK, and more wet [weather](https://www.nottinghampost.com/all-about/weather) is expected this weekend for [Nottingham](https://www.nottinghampost.com/all-about/nottingham-city-centre). Whilst Friday, December 29, is expected to be relatively dry, with cloudy and at some parts sunny weather, the rain is due to return over the weekend. Looking ahead to Saturday, December 30, the Met Office states: "A chilly start but soon turning milder with cloud increasing to bring a spell of rain through the morning. What three words would you use to describe Nottinghamshire? [ Let us know](https://ngx.me/5blydtt) "Largely cloudy and often dry during the afternoon, though becoming windy. Maximum temperature 10 °C." Saturday will see highs of 10C and lows of 6C as rain is predicted throughout the day, with especially heavy rain from 8am to 11am and from 7pm to 11pm. "There will be some light rain on Sunday, December 31, but the weather will predominately be cloudy. In its outlook for Sunday to Tuesday, January 2, the Met Office forecasts: "Windy with scattered blustery showers on Sunday. "Probably drier by Monday with fewer showers, though still breezy. Mainly dry with lighter winds Tuesday. Temperatures near or slightly below normal."

author: Unlocking the Secrets of 441 Angel Number Meaning

This

From numerological interpretations to angelic messages, 441 is an important numerical sequence with special powers.

She knew this was not just any ordinary number – 441 has a powerful significance that she wanted to understand.
The 441
angel number carries great significance for those who believe in the divine power of the Universe.

Meaning of Angel Number 441
The 441
angel number is a powerful symbol of guidance and support from the spiritual realm.
It encourages us to create our own reality by building a solid foundation. Trusting in our spirit guides, and being open to new opportunities as they arise.
441 also serves as an assurance that we are on the right path at the right time and good energies will be sent our way to help us succeed.

With 441
angel number, we can take advantage of fresh starts and new projects. Trusting that we are on the right track at the right time.

author: David Stringer
title: Hot soups of the season in Columbia
text:
No gazpacho allowed: today we’re talking hot soups. As the cold weather sets in, nothing beats the warmth of a soup du jour.
Grab a spoon and some saltines, and explore Cola’s rich soup scene:
Backstreets, 2400 Devine St.| A local favorite, Backstreets offers daily homemade soups. Enjoy them in a bread bowl or paired with a Caesar or garden salad.
Blue Marlin, 1200 Lincoln St. | This Columbia staple serves up Lowcountry classics with a twist, like the rich and creamy She Crab Soup or the hearty New Orleans Seafood Gumbo. Pair your bowl with one of the fresh salads, such as the Fried Green Tomato Salad or Charleston Crab Cake Salad. You can’t go wrong with any pairing.
Boca Grande Burritos, 4525 Forest Dr. 2-A | Beyond burritos, Boca Grande serves a special three-bean soup this season, available by the cup or bowl.
Casa Linda’s, 2009 N Beltline Blvd.| Savor the flavors of Sopa de Pollo with marinated chicken in a broth brimming with diced tomatoes, onions, cilantro, and avocado.
Coa Agaveria Y Cocina, 823-A Lady St. | Coa showcases two unique soups: the Pozole Verde with chicken, hominy, cabbage, radish, onion, and the Sopa Azteca with chicken, panela cheese, chile pasilla, avocado, and crispy tortilla.
Dragon Room, 803 Gervais St. | Slurp up the umami-packed Wagyu Phở, rich Smoked Chicken Ramen, or start your meal with the Miso Soup with grilled tofu and lemon zest.
Duke’s Pad Thai, 904 Knox Abbott Dr., Cayce | Choose from a variety of soups like Tom Yum, Tom Kha, Miso, or Dumpling, or create your own at its noodle bar.
Kao Thai, 1307 Main St. | Dip into the Tom Kha Chicken, a spicy and tangy coconut soup featuring chicken, tomatoes, mushrooms, galangal root, kaffir lime leaves, lemongrass, and cilantro.
Menkoi Ramen House, 1004 Gervais St. | A favorite spot of both COLAtoday City Editors, Sam goes for the Chicken Ramen with an extra egg and David’s favorite is the Shoyu Ramen with marinated pork, both starting with the Gyoza appetizer.
Pro tip: If you are ordering to-go, you can ask for your noodles and soup to be packaged separately so your noodles stay fresh and al dente until you get home.
Mr. Friendly’s, 2001-A Greene St.| Warm up with one of the rotating soups, like the creamy Roasted Red Pepper-Tomato Bisque with herb goat cheese or the hearty Southwest Chorizo + Black Bean Soup topped with rice and cilantro sour cream.
No Name Deli, multiple locations | Try the rotating soup du jour or the classic vegetable soup, perfectly paired with a side of cornbread.
Soundbites Eatery, 1425 Sumter St.| You know what pairs well with the Notorious B.L.T.? A homemade soup like Spicy Tomato Bisque or the Loaded Potato soup.
Spotted Salamander, 1531 Richland St.| At Spotted, keeping up with the daily specials is a must. Today, it’s Cajun Cream of Tomato and White Bean Chili—mmm, I’ll take one of each! But tomorrow? It might be the Cheeseburger Soup, a fan favorite you absolutely can’t miss.
The Gourmet Shop, 724 Saluda Ave | This Five Points staple, while mostly known for its chicken salad, also offers Tomato Bisque, a long-time favorite.
The Other Store, 4130 Bethel Church Rd. | One of Cola’s hidden gems, where you’ll find a variety of soups like corn chowder, chicken noodle, and chicken bog. Watch for gazpacho on the specials board when spring flowers bloom.
We know this is just a sample of the soups offered around town, many of these suggested by our readers. If we’re missing your favorite soup, let us know so we can share it with you.
